intro: Lotus macbridei, commonly known as the MacBride's lotus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has palmately compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
